pénale.

mecánico, incluidos los sistemas de almacenamiento y recuperación de información, sin la previa autorización por escrito del IB. Además, la

que incluye, a título enunciativo, editoriales, profesores particulares, servicios de apoyo académico o ayuda para el estudio, colegios

mediante plataformas digitales—, ya sea incluido en tasas o no, está prohibido y constituye un delito.

                                                                            –3–                                          M23/4/BIOLO/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


Subject Details: Biology SL Paper 2 Markscheme

Candidates are required to answer all questions in Section A and one out of two questions in Section B. Maximum total = 50 marks.

1.    Each row in the “Question” column relates to the smallest subpart of the question.

2.    The maximum mark for each question subpart is indicated in the “Total” column.

3.    Each marking point in the “Answers” column is shown by means of a semicolon (;) at the end of the marking point.

4.    A question subpart may have more marking points than the total allows. This will be indicated by “max” written after the mark in the “Total” column.
      The related rubric, if necessary, will be outlined in the “Notes” column.

5.    An alternative word is indicated in the “Answers” column by a slash (/). Either word can be accepted.

6.    An alternative answer is indicated in the “Answers” column by “OR”. Either answer can be accepted.

7.    An alternative markscheme is indicated in the “Answers” column under heading ALTERNATIVE 1 etc. Either alternative can be accepted.

8.    Words inside brackets ( ) in the “Answers” column are not necessary to gain the mark.

9.    Words that are underlined are essential for the mark.

10.   The order of marking points does not have to be as in the “Answers” column, unless stated otherwise in the “Notes” column.
                                                                           –4–                                          M23/4/BIOLO/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


                                                                        Section B
Extended response questions - quality of construction

        Extended response questions for SLP2 carry a mark total of [16]. Of these marks, [15] are awarded for content and [1] for the quality of
         the answer.

        [1] for quality is to be awarded when:
             the candidate’s answers are clear enough to be understood without re-reading.
             the candidate has answered the question succinctly with little or no repetition or irrelevant material.
                                                                              –5–                                   M23/4/BIOLO/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M




                                                                        Section A

     Question                                          Answers                                                      Notes                        Total
1.     a        a. nearly half is Bacteroides / more Bacteroides (than other enterotypes);
                b. few Prevotella/fewer Prevotella than in P and R
                   OR
                   less Faecalibacterium than other enterotypes
                                                                                                                                                2 max
                   OR
                   Ruminococcus is the lowest in B2;
                c. only 40% other taxa / fewer other taxa (than other enterotypes) / less overall
                   diversity (of taxa);

1.     b        1.9 x 1011 / 190000 million / 190 billion (cells per gram);                         Cells per gram not needed as in stem.
                                                                                                    Accept 1.80 x 1011 to 1.95 x 1011.             1

                                                                                                                                            (continued…)
                                                                           –6–                                      M23/4/BIOLO/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


(Question 1 continued)

      Question                                           Answer                                                     Notes                     Total

 1.     c        a. lower values for cell counts in B2 (than in R) / converse
                     OR
                     median is higher in R (than in B2) / R median is 1.9 versus B2 median is 1.1
                     OR
                     lower number of cell counts in R;
                 b. all counts in R higher than third/75th/upper quartile in B2
                     OR                                                                                                                      2 max
                     25-75% range (box) in B2 is smaller than in R;                                 The ranges are basically the same.
                 c. R maximum 3.1 versus B2 maximum is 2.1
                     OR
                     R maximum is higher than B2 max;
                 d. B2 minimum is lower than R minimum;

 1.     d        a. only one sample/count/data point;

                 b. only analysed feces from one person (with this enterotype);                                                              1 max
                 c. not a big enough sample;

                                                                                                                                         (continued…)
                                                                         –7–                           M23/4/BIOLO/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


(Question 1 continued)
      Question                                         Answer                                           Notes                     Total

 1.     e    i    0.35;                                                                Accept any values between 0.33 and
                                                                                       0.37.
                                                                                                                                    1
                                                                                       Accept 35%.

 1.     e    ii   B2 is associated/commoner/more prevalent in people with higher BMI
                  OR                                                                                                                1
                  (prevalence of) B2 increases as BMI increases;                       Accept positive correlation/OWTTE.

 1.     f         a. R is more common/prevalent in people with low BMI;                So ‘R is far more common in people
                                                                                       with low BMI’, would gain both a and b.
                  b. statement about it being far more common;
                                                                                                                                 2 max
                  c. but this correlation does not prove that R causes low BMI;
                  d. low BMI could(actually) be the cause of higher prevalence of R;
                                                                                                                             (continued…)
                                                                         –8–                                           M23/4/BIOLO/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


(Question 1 continued)
      Question                                        Answers                                                          Notes                 Total

 1.     g        a. high/highest % of B2 enterotype in people with BMI greater than (or equal to)      One for correct data and one for
                    30 with no statins                                                                 discussion
                     OR
                     taking statins could reduce the percentage of B2 enterotype in people with BMI
                     ≥ 30
                     OR
                     reducing BMI to below 30 could lower % of people with B2 enterotype without
                     taking statins;
                                                                                                                                              2
                 b. but statins may not cause a person to change from B2 to another enterotype
                     OR
                     lower B2 in those taking statins if BMI is >30 so might reduce IBD/inflammatory
                     bowel disease
                     OR
                     but when BMI < 30, there is almost double the prevalence of B2 in those taking
                     statins so might not have an effect / increase (prevalence of) inflammatory
                     bowel disease;

     Question                                       Answers                                                          Notes                   Total
2.     a        12;                                                                                No alternative.                            1

2.     b        a. male and female gamete genotypes/alleles shown as P and p (or others            Accept other upper-case and lower-
                   following convention with a suitable key) in a punnet grid;                     case letters for the alleles.
                b. F2 genotypes shown as PP, Pp, pP and pp;
                c. F2 phenotypes indicated for each genotype on the Punnett grid / 3 purple to 1
                   white ratio indicated;
                                                                                                                                              3




                                                                                                   No punnet grid = 2 MAX.
                                                                                                   Allow ECF if alleles incorrect.
2.     c        chance / OWWTE;                                                                    (any of the usual mechanisms causing
                                                                                                   recombination of alleles) NOT mutation.
                                                                                                                                              1
                                                                                                   Any wording that implies the bigger the
                                                                                                   sample size, the closer to 3:1.

 Question                                         Answers                               Notes                 Total
3.   a      a. smoking/tobacco;
            b. passive smoking;
            c. Radon/other radiation;                                                                        1 max
            d. exposure to arsenic/asbestos/smoke from coal burning/fires/silica/rock
               dust/vehicle exhaust fumes/nitrogen oxides;

3.   b      a. fewer/smaller/lack of alveoli/air spaces;
            b. many cells/nuclei per area / much denser tissue;                                              1 max
            c. more cells undergoing mitosis (in the tumour);

3.   c      See
            a. more mitosis
               OR
               cells in prophase/metaphase/anaphase/telophase;
                                                                                                             2 max
            Why
            b. more dividing cells/tumour cell divide uncontrollably
               OR
               a higher mitotic index;

     Question                                        Answers                                                          Notes                       Total
4.     a    i    heterotrophic because it feeds on/eats food/other organisms /eats ants/termites/   Do not accept “it is not autotrophic” as it
                 doesn’t photosynthesise/does not produce its own food;                             is part of the stem question.                  1

4.     a    ii   a. what (prey) it eats/feeds on/ stomach content;                                  Do not award points for indicating that
                 b. the trophic level of what (prey) it eats/feeds on/the trophic level of          predator information is needed.
                    ants/termites;                                                                                                                2 max
                 c. trophic level is the position an organism occupies in the food chain/web;


4.     b         a. pentadactyl;
                 b. homologous with limbs of other vertebrates;
                                                                                                                                                  2 max
                 c. due to common ancestry;
                 d. adaptation;

4.     c    i    three;                                                                                                                            1

4.     c    ii   by counting the number of base/amino acid sequence differences;                                                                   1
                                                                         – 12 –                                    M23/4/BIOLO/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


     Question                                        Answers                                                       Notes                     Total
5.     a        a. water forms hydrogen bonds but methane does not/hydrogen bonds form           Mpa; a clear difference between the 2
                   between water molecules, but are absent in methane;                           substances is expected.
                b. energy needed to break hydrogen bonds/intermolecular attractions;
                c. hydrogen bonds raise the freezing point/boiling point/heat capacity/heat of                                               2 max
                                                                                                 Mpc; do not accept “water has a high
                   vaporization                                                                  boiling point”, etc. if no reference is
                                                                                                 made to hydrogen bonds.

5.     b        a. boiling point of methane is -160°C
                   OR
                   methane is in gaseous state when temperatures are above/higher than
                   -160ºC;                                                                                                                    2
                b. temperatures on Earth are always above -160°C;                                Mpb; accept reference to Earth average
                                                                                                 temperature being warmer / higher than
                                                                                                 methane boiling point.

5.     c        a. heat of vaporization is low/heat of vaporization is only 760 J g-1            Mpa: the second statement aims at the
                   OR                                                                            idea of a comparison.
                                                                                                 Mpa: accept vice versa.
                   methane has a lower heat of vaporization compared to water;
                                                                                                                                             2 max
                b. no hydrogen bonds need to be broken;                                          If methane is not referred to directly in
                c. not enough heat removed when methane evaporates;                              the answer, then award [1 max].
                d. methane boils at -160 °C so would already be a gas (in/on the human body);
                                                                             – 13 –                                      M23/4/BIOLO/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


                                                                          Section B

           Clarity of communication: [1]
           The candidate’s answers are clear enough to be understood without re-reading. The candidate has answered the question succinctly
           with little or no repetition or irrelevant material.



     Question                                             Answers                                                        Notes                 Total
6.     a           a. speed of reaction/catalysis increases as temperature rises;                        Graphs would need to be well
                                                                                                         annotated.
                   b. faster molecular motion so more collisions between substrate and active site;
                   c. denaturation at higher temperatures;
                   d. (denaturation causes) shape/conformation/structure of enzyme/active site
                      altered/damaged;                                                                                                        4 max

                   e. an enzyme works fastest at its optimum temperature;
                   f.   inactivation at lower temperatures (due to very few collisions);
                   g. sketch graph to model the effect of temperature on enzyme activity;                Must not be bell shaped.

6.     b           a. secretes thyroxin;
                   b. thyroxin causes the metabolic rate to rise;
                   c. heat released by metabolism;
                                                                                                                                              4 max
                   d. thyroxin increases generation of body heat;
                   e. thyroxin stimulates shivering/stimulates brown adipose tissue (to release heat);
                   f.   more thyroxin secreted if body temperature too low/converse;
                                                                                                                                          (continued…)
                                                                             – 14 –                      M23/4/BIOLO/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M




(Question 6 continued)

      Question                                            Answers                                        Notes                      Total
 6.     c         a. release of carbon dioxide;
                  b. combustion of fossil fuels produces carbon dioxide;
                  c. forest fires (caused by humans) produce carbon dioxide;
                  d. deforestation reduces carbon dioxide uptake by photosynthesis;
                  e. release of methane;
                  f.     from cattle/sheep/ruminant digestive systems / other verified source of
                                                                                                                                    7 max
                         anthropogenic methane;
                  g. greenhouse effect / carbon dioxide/methane is a greenhouse gas;
                  h. carbon dioxide/methane allow short wave radiation in sunlight to pass through
                     the atmosphere;
                  i.     longer wave/infra-red radiation emitted by the warmed Earth’s surface;
                  j.     carbon dioxide/methane absorbs/reflects back longer wave/infra-red radiation;

                                                                                                                 [Plus one mark for quality]
                                                                        – 15 –                                     M23/4/BIOLO/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


     Question                                       Answers                                                        Notes                   Total
7.     a        a. plasma membrane is thin layer forming outer boundary;                           Allow any point made on an
                                                                                                   annotated diagram.
                b. cytoplasm fills space between membrane and nucleus;
                                                                                                   Do not award any marks for just
                c. nucleus enclosed in nuclear membrane / nuclear membrane enclosing               labels. Descriptions are needed.
                     nucleus;

                d. chromosomes inside the nucleus/ visible during mitosis/ as rods (of condensed
                     DNA);

                e. mitochondria with cristae/double membranes;

                f.   (80S) ribosomes seen as dots free in cytoplasm/attached to rough ER;                                                 7 max
                g. endoplasmic reticulum is a network interconnected tubes/ membranes /rough
                     ER has ribosomes/ smooth ER does not;

                h. Golgi apparatus with stack of sacs/cisternae/curved or folded membranes/
                     vesicles budding off;

                i.   vesicles which are small membrane sacs;

                j.   lysosome which contains enzymes/which is densely staining;

                k. any other organelle that would be visible correctly described;

                                                                                                                                      (continued…)
                                                                              – 16 –                                  M23/4/BIOLO/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


(Question 7 continued)
 7.    b          a. respiration/cell respiration;
                  b. energy released from glucose/lipids/organic compounds;
                  c. anaerobic respiration does not require oxygen;
                  d. lactate is produced in anaerobic respiration/word equation for anaerobic
                     respiration;
                  e. oxygen used in aerobic respiration;
                                                                                                                                               5 max
                  f.     carbon dioxide and water produced in aerobic respiration/word equation for
                         aerobic respiration;
                  g. mitochondria used for aerobic respiration;
                  h. larger yield of ATP from aerobic than anaerobic respiration;



 7.    c          a. reptiles dry skin versus amphibians moist skin;                                  Both reptile and amphibian should be
                                                                                                      mentioned in each distinction.
                  b. reptiles with scales versus amphibians not having scales / reptiles scaly skin
                     versus amphibians soft skin;
                  c. reptile eggs have (soft) shells versus amphibian eggs no shell/coated in gel;
                  d. reptiles internal fertilisation/sperm enters female versus amphibians external
                     fertilisation                                                                                                             3 max
                       OR
                         amphibians require water for reproduction, reptiles do not;
                  e. reptiles do not have larval stage versus amphibians have larval stage;
                  f.     reptiles do not develop gills versus amphibian larvae have gills;

                                                                                                                            [Plus one mark for quality]
